CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :
“ All expenditure by the ORG for social purposes , and the amounts and aims thereof , shall be determined by LAW . ”
“ Everyone shall have the right to work , including the possibility to earn his or her living by labour which he or she freely chooses or to which he or she freely agrees .
... The right to timely payment for work shall be protected by law . ”
“ The independence and immunity of judges shall be guaranteed by LAW and the laws of GPE .
... Influencing judges in any manner shall be prohibited . ”
“ Justice shall be administered by professional judges and , in cases determined by law , by lay assessors and jurors .

Professional judges shall not belong to political parties or trade unions , take part in any political activity , hold a representative mandate , occupy any other paid position or perform other remunerated work except in the academic , teaching and creative spheres . ... ”
“ In the administration of justice , judges shall be independent and subject only to the law . ”

“ The ORG shall ensure the funding and proper conditions for the operation of the courts and the activity of judges . Expenditure for the maintenance of the courts shall be allocated separately in the ORG budget of GPE . ... ”

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW provides that judges ' salaries and social - security benefits shall be such as to ensure their financial independence and shall be determined in accordance with LAW . The amount of a judicial salary can not be reduced .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows ( PERSON no . CARDINAL ) :
“ ... Budgetary funds shall be spent for the purposes determined by budgetary allocations only ... ”
“ ... Budget commitments can be undertaken and payments from the ORG budget made only in so far as budgetary allocations exist for these purposes . ”

CARDINAL . LAW provides that the writing - off of funds from the ORG budget pursuant to a court judgment delivered in favour of the employees of an organisation in receipt of budgetary funds , who are entitled to certain benefits , shall be carried out from the single treasury account of ORG at the expense and within the limits of the budget allocations fixed for financing that organisation .
CARDINAL . The ORG budget provided UAH CARDINAL for the enforcement of judgments awarding judicial salaries and benefit arrears .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the PERSON provides that the bailiffs ' departments of ORG shall be responsible for the enforcement of judgments concerning the debts of the executive branch of Government .
CARDINAL . The PERSON provides that ORG shall be responsible for organising the financial planning and accounting of the courts and for preparing an estimate of the courts ' budgetary needs .
CARDINAL . NORP In accordance with CARDINAL of the LAW , ORG is responsible for the implementation of the ORG budget and for monitoring its expenditure .
CARDINAL . The relevant extracts from the Recommendation read as follows :
CARDINAL . Proper conditions should be provided to enable judges to work efficiently and , in particular , by :
b. ensuring that the status and remuneration of judges is commensurate with the dignity of their profession and burden of responsibilities ; ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant extracts from the Explanatory Memorandum read as follows :

“ CARDINAL . Status and remuneration are important factors determining appropriate working conditions ( see paragraph CARDINAL.b ) . The status accorded to judges should be commensurate with the dignity of their profession and their remuneration should represent sufficient compensation for their burden of responsibilities . These factors are essential to the independence of judges , especially the recognition of the importance of their role as judges , expressed in terms of due respect and adequate financial remuneration .

CARDINAL . Paragraph CARDINAL.b is closely bound up with the reference in Principle I to all decisions concerning the professional life of judges , which obviously includes their status and their remuneration . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant extracts from LAW of LAW on the Statute for Judges , “ Remuneration and Social Welfare ” , read as follows :

“ CARDINAL . Judges exercising judicial functions in a professional capacity are entitled to remuneration , the level of which is fixed so as to shield them from pressures aimed at influencing their decisions and more generally their behaviour within their jurisdiction , thereby impairing their independence and impartiality . ”
